article:
Events and trends
* 568 BCâAmtalqa succeeds his brother Aspelta as king of Kush.
* 567 BCâFormer pharaoh Apries invades Egypt with Babylonian help but is
  defeated by Saite pharaoh Amasis II (also known as Ahmose II).
* 567 BC-On 25 May Servius Tullius, king of Rome, celebrates a triumph for his
  victory over the Etruscans.
* 566 BC The first known Panathenaic Games of Ancient Greece are held in Athens.
* 562 BCâAmel-Marduk succeeds Nebuchadnezzar II as king of Babylon.
* 560 BCâNeriglissar succeeds Amel-Marduk as king of Babylon.
* 560 BC/561 BCâCroesus becomes king of Lydia.
* 560 BCâAn aristocrat named Pisistratus seizes the Acropolis of Athens and
  declares himself tyrant. He is deposed in the same year.
* c. 560 BCâCalf bearer (Moscophoros), from the Acropolis, Athens, is made. It
  is now at Acropolis Museum, Athens.

Significant people *564 BC - Death of Aesop, the Ancient Greek fable teller.
*April, 563 BCâBirth of Siddhartha Gautama, later known as Gautama Buddha in
Lumbini, Nepal *563 BCâDeath of Queen Maya, mother of Siddhartha Gautama *562
BCâDeath of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Neo-Babylonia
